alert.note: Alert for Wyoming Black Hills (Wyoming) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS RapidCity (Western South Dakota and Northeastern Wyoming)
info.headline: High Wind Warning issued April 05 at 8:09PM MDT until April 06 at 3:00AM MDT by NWS RapidCity
info.description: ...HIGH WIND WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 3 AM MDT WEDNESDAY... * WHAT...Northwest winds 25 to 35 mph with gusts up to 65 mph. * WHERE...In South Dakota, the Northern Foot Hills, the Northern Black Hills and the Central Black Hills. In Wyoming, the Wyoming Black Hills. * WHEN...Until 3 AM MDT Wednesday. * IMPACTS...The high winds may blow down large trees and damage roofs, small outbuildings, and signs. Power outages are possible. Travel could be difficult, especially for high profile vehicles. Strong winds can cause blowing dust, reduced visibility, and flying debris. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Snow is expected to develop late tonight and continue through Wednesday. The High Wind Warning will change to a Winter Storm Warning for the northern and central Black Hills and the Bear Lodge mountains, and a Winter Weather Advisory for the northern foothills around Spearfish. Please see the latest Winter Weather Message, as the combination of snowfall and areas of blowing snow will impact travel.
info.instruction: Persons outdoors should watch for flying or falling objects that may injure you. If you are driving, be prepared for sudden wind gusts that can cause you to lose control of your vehicle, especially on open stretches, or as you approach the crest of hills. Also be alert for debris or dust blowing across the road.
